id: Harry Potter Quiz @ 1852, Wellington-55 Cleveland Street, Brooklyn, Wellington-Facebook
name: Harry Potter Quiz @ 1852, Wellington
description:
Gee Quiz is back with a brand new Harry Potter quiz for 2025!
Gather your HP crew and come along to an amazing night of Harry Potter themed trivia at 1852 Pub & Kitchen, Wellington on Saturday 2nd August, 7pm sharp!
With lots of trivia, bonus games and dress ups, it's set to be another magical evening of quizzing!
This event WILL likely sell out, so get in fast to secure your table!
https://www.trybooking.com/nz/XWI Once you book, you will receive an automated email with a link to a Google Form where you will be required to enter your team name.

id: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
name: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing
venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Yin Yoga & Sound Healing Slow yoga, soothing sounds, and a nourishing plant-based meal—a grounding evening from start to finish.
This special session combines the stillness of yin yoga with the soothing power of sound healing—an immersive experience to calm the body and quiet the mind.
Yin yoga is a slow, meditative practice where poses are held for several minutes, allowing the body to open gently and the nervous system to reset.
Guided by Nicola’s thoughtful approach to yin and Nizaad’s calming presence with sound, this evening is a space to simply be—to feel, to unwind, and to receive.
To close the night, we’ll share a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert—included in your ticket.

id: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
name: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos
venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos Transform the exhausting cycle of mental loops, rumination, and decision paralysis into mental clarity and peace.
This 60-minute workshop will give you practical tools to break the cycle.
Plus, your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert—because taking care of your mind is best supported by feeding your body well.
Meet Krishnaloka, your host Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology.
Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

id: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
name: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.
This moon-themed session invites you to tune into the gentle, reflective energy of the lunar cycle—a time for slowing down, softening, and simply being.
After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together.
It’s included in your ticket and is a lovely way to gently transition back, connect, and enjoy wholesome food in good company.
Meet Karuna, your host Trained as a primary school teacher, she also has a background in psychology and Spanish.

id: Hataitai community centre Raranga-27 Arcus Way, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
name: Hataitai community centre Raranga
venue: 27 Arcus Way, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
description:
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Hataitai Community Centre, warmly extends an invitation for you to Experience the joy of learning and refreshing your knowledge of flax weaving.
• New participants should bring 5-10 rau (blades) of harakeke, a sharp pair of scissors, an old towel, and a bag for any unused rau.
• Returning participants should bring 30-40 rau (blades) of harakeke along with their tools.
A Koha (donation) is appreciated to the centre, but it is not a requirement for participation.
Come and enjoy the weaving experience while connecting with the rich tradition of Māori arts and crafts.

id: Alex Baker Mayoral campaign event-4 Moncrieff Street, Mt Victoria, Wellington-Facebook
name: Alex Baker Mayoral campaign event
description:
Join me at the Tararua Tramping Club to hear about my vision for the city, what I will prioritise and why.
This is a great opportunity to ask questions, show your support, and get involved.
See you there!

id: July Walk – Seton Nossiter Park, Johnsonville/Grenada Villiage-100 Mark Avenue, Grenada Village,, Wellington-Facebook
name: July Walk – Seton Nossiter Park, Johnsonville/Grenada Villiage
description:
Our walk this month will be at Seton Nossiter Park.
It has been a while since we’ve been here!
We’ll meet at the Mark Avenue entrance car park.
There is a lot of off lead space on this walk.
Anyone and everyone welcome

id: Vagtastic Voyage Wellington-154 Vivian Street, Wellington-Facebook

description:
Pōnoke !
!!
Wellington !
First show of the north island line up at Valhalla with @lavendermenacesucks and No sector � To celebrate our final single release: privileged man.
tickets available now on UTR

id: Field Day: Wellington International Airport - 2 Aug 2025-Station Drive off Stewart Duff Drive, Rongotai , Wellington-Facebook
name: Field Day: Wellington International Airport - 2 Aug 2025
venue: Station Drive off Stewart Duff Drive, Rongotai , Wellington
description:
Get a behind the scenes look at Airport operations including the Airport Fire Service, their equipment and capabilities, how they operate day-to-day and in the event of an emergency on site, plus gain knowledge of other Airport functions that the public may not ever get to see.
This field day will allow participants to get an understanding of airport operations including Operations, AVSEC, Customs, MPI and the Control Tower.
We will also look at the Airport Fire trucks, equipment, PPE, simulator/training aids and discuss how they respond to incidents in and around the airport and show you what the day-to-day life of an Airport Firefighter looks like.
What the capabilities (and limitations) of Wellington Airport Fire are.
The fee must be paid at registration to secure your spot.

id: Night of the Full Moon-40 Salamanca Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
name: Night of the Full Moon
venue: 40 Salamanca Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
description:
Embrace your inner lycanthrope this August as we celebrate the final full moon of winter.
This evening event features a variety of lunar activities, including ambient listening under the Moon Dome, guided movements with Kaia Hawkins of Manahau Embodied Movement, mask-making, and group howling.
Weather permitting, we’ll be able to moongaze through the telescopes.
This event is part of Takurua Hauora: Winter Wellness, a Wellington event series promoting health and wellbeing inspired by Sir Mason Durie’s Whare Tapa Whā model.
Saturday 9 August | 7pm – 10pm | Space Place Spaces are limited.

id: Moon Open Decks - hosted by Gandoof-167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
name: Moon Open Decks - hosted by Gandoof
venue: 167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
description:
Moon Open Decks!
DJs & producers of all experience levels are welcome to come & share their tunes We'll be using an XDJ-RR on Moon's house soundsystem, so bring your tracks on a USB (ideally processed in rekordbox, aiff/wav or mp3), bring some friends, maybe make some new ones, or just come down for a boogie!
It's always a fun, eclectic mix of genres.
Free entry!
Gandoof is a Wellington-based DJ known for deep, genre-blending sets that move bodies and minds.

id: Your Friendly Neighbourhood Record Fair-Public Toilets Ngaio, Collingwood St, Ngaio, Wellington 6035, New Zealand-Facebook
name: Your Friendly Neighbourhood Record Fair
venue: Public Toilets Ngaio, Collingwood St, Ngaio, Wellington 6035, New Zealand
description:
Step into "Your Friendly Neighbourhood Record Fair" hosted by On The Record!
Date: August 23 2025 Time: 11:00 AM Venue: Ngaio Town Hall 1 Ottawa Road Ngaio Calling all music lovers and vinyl seekers!
Immerse yourself in a special mix of market energy and melodic sounds at this record fair designed for collectors in the suburbs.
Uncover rare finds, hidden gems, and musical treasures in every groove.
Experience the excitement of sifting through crates filled with nostalgic tunes and timeless classics.
